result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight Person III

Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Dwight Person III in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Dwight Person III.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense states that defendant's dates were mixed as he also has a misdemeanor case and also his phone was turned off and is why RCAP could not contact him.  Did not know he was testing randomly.
Defendant to test forthwith and return with results.

CASE RECALLED AT 2:07 PM  - SAME APPEARANCES.
Defendant returns from RCAP with negative results.
BTC: Bench warrant vacated, bond reinstated.

of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records Without Extrinsic Evidence, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Expert Testimony, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dwight Person III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Dwight Person III. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
